BARBELL_SQUAT.description: The Squat is the king of all exercises. Squats work the whole body: Your legs bend and straighten to move the weight; your abs and lower back muscles stabilize your trunk while your legs move; your upper back, shoulders and arms balance the bar on your back
BARBELL_SQUAT.name: Barbell Squat

badForm: Bounce the bar against the floor
Start with bar in the air
DEADLIFT.description: The “dead” in Deadlift stands for dead weight. So every rep must start on the floor, from a dead stop. You don’t Deadlift top-down like on the Squat or Bench Press. You start at the bottom, pull the weight up and then return it to the floor
goodForm: Bend knees until shins touch the bar
DEADLIFT.name: Deadlift

badForm: Hold the bar with a thumbless grip
BENCH_PRESS.description: Bench-press is a full body compound exercise that works your chest, shoulders and triceps. The bench press is the most effective exercise for upper-body strength.
goodForm: Grip with thumbs around the bar
BENCH_PRESS.name: Bench-press

badForm: Keep your elbows behind the bar
MILITARY_PRESS.description: The Overhead Press is a full body, compound exercise. Your shoulders and arms press the weight over your head while your legs, lower back and abs balance you. The Overhead Press is one of the best exercises to build strong, muscular and healthy shoulders with bigger arms.
goodForm: Keep feet flat on the floor
Hold bar low in your hand
Grip with hands just outside shoulders
MILITARY_PRESS.name: Overhead press

CHINUPS.description: Pullups (and chin-ups) are hard because you have to lift your entire body weight on day one. If you can't do one chin-up, do negatives: Climb up to the top position, and lift yourself down. Everybody is stronger on the way down, so you can do this. When you can do 10 good form negatives, you can do one chin-up.
goodForm: Grab pullup bar with palms down
Pull up by pulling elbows towards the floor
Go all the way up until chin passes bar
CHINUPS.name: Chin-up

goodForm: Hold abs briefly at top of movement
CRUNCHES.name: Weighted crunches

BENT_OVER_ROW.description: Barbell Rows are a full body, compound exercise. They work your upper-back, lower back, hips and arms. They build a stronger, muscular back and bigger biceps. Barbell Rows are one of the most effective assistance exercises you can do to increase your Squat, Bench Press and Deadlift.
goodForm: Stand with mid-foot under the bar
Pull bar against your lower chest
BENT_OVER_ROW.name: Bent-over row

DIPS.description: Dips are a compound, body-weight exercise. You do Dips by first raising yourself on two dip bars with straight arms. Lower your body until your shoulders are below your elbows. Push yourself up until your arms are straight again. Dips work your chest, shoulders, back and arm muscles.
DIPS.name: Tricep dips
